keyTakeAways: A bomb exploded outside the home of Italian investigative journalist Sigfrido Ranucci, damaging two cars and a nearby house.
Ranucci, host of RAI’s 'Report,' has long been under police protection due to threats related to his investigative journalism.
The device was rudimentary, likely made from firework explosives, and planted outside his front gate in Campo Ascolano, about 19 miles south of Rome.
No injuries were reported, though Ranucci expressed shock and concern.
The incident has prompted solidarity from colleagues and politicians, including Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni, who condemned the act as intimidation of free media.
Anti-Mafia prosecutors have opened a formal investigation into the bombing, alleging use of mafia-style methods.
Ranucci’s program 'Report' has frequently clashed with the Meloni government, leading to legal actions from several ministers and coalition members.
Interior Minister Matteo Piantedosi confirmed that Ranucci’s police escort will be increased.

summaryOfNewsArticle: A bomb exploded outside the home of Italian investigative journalist Sigfrido Ranucci in Campo Ascolano, south of Rome, damaging two vehicles and a nearby house. Ranucci, host of RAI’s influential program 'Report,' has long faced threats due to his critical reporting on government actions. Although no injuries were reported, the attack has triggered widespread condemnation, with Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni calling it an act of intimidation against press freedom. Anti-Mafia prosecutors have opened an investigation, suspecting mafia-style methods. The incident follows years of legal battles between Ranucci’s program and members of Prime Minister Meloni’s government, including ministers Giancarlo Giorgetti and Adolfo Urso and members of her Brothers of Italy party, highlighting deep political tensions over media independence and investigative journalism.
title: Bomb explodes outside home of top Italian investigative journalist
